channel.title: distributions on Machine Learning
channel.description: Recent content in distributions on Machine Learning

item.title: Play Linux System Distributions Online in a Web Browser
item.description: Note: many with 5 minute inactive limit and 30 minutes per session limit. CodeAnyWhere container (tested 2022.02, w/ root-sudo & git): py, c/c++, java, php, js, ruby, h5, wordpress, .net, rust, go, node.js. (can skip all payment part). terminal speed good. limitted free trial time. WebMinal (tested 2022.02, NO root/git) (CN network issue for home page, but ok after): Federo CentOS7 (py2.7), right-sided lessons/tutorials (great for new users): shell, MySQL, Python etc.

item.title: Nix Linux Distribution Comparison, Timeline and Relationship
item.description: Main branches directly from linux kernels: Debian, (K)Ubuntu/Deepin … RedHat, CentOS, Fedora … Slackware, Suse, OpenSuse (Leap vs. Tumbleweed) … Arch, Manjaro … Android … RHEL = Red Hat (Inc.) Enterprise Linux SLE = SUSE Linux Enterprise openSUSE Leap <–> CentOS(Rocky Linux) openSUSE Tumbleweed <–> Fedora Sizes Just After Installation (Disk & RAM) # OS Installation DISK size en (GB) Installation DISK size cn (GB) RAM (GB) Notes Deepin 20.4 ?
